Jump animation speed.\nThe higher the value, the faster the animation.
Determines how strongly the jump animation will be expressed.\nThe higher the value, the higher the amplitude of the animation.\nA value of 0 turns off the jump animation.
The speed of the landing animation after falling.\nThe higher the value, the faster the animation.
Determines how pronounced the landing animation will be.\nThe higher the value, the higher the amplitude of the animation.\nA value of 0 turns off the landing animation.
During crouching, the weapon will sway slightly, which can interfere with aiming.\nThis option allows you to not play the crouch jitter animation while you aim.
Determines how fast the weapon will jitter when crouching.\nThe higher the value, the faster the animation.

Determines how pronounced the crouch jitter animation will be when crouching.\nThe higher the value, the higher the amplitude of the animation.\nA value of 0 turns off the crouch jitter animation when crouching.
Play random sway animation for weapons only
The random hands sway animation can be annoying when using a PDA.\nThis option allows you to play this animation only for weapons, so as not to interfere when using a PDA or other devices.

A person cannot stand absolutely still, and this animation adds slight swaying of the character's arms.\nThis option determines the speed of the swaying animation.\nThe higher the value, the faster the animation.

Play breathing animation for weapons only

The animation of the arms swaying when breathing can be annoying when using a PDA.\nThis option allows you to play this animation only for weapons, so as not to interfere when using a PDA or other devices.
The speed of the breathing animation in a calm state.\nThe higher the value, the faster the animation.
The speed of the breathing animation when stamina is low.\nThe higher the value, the faster the animation.

Determines how strongly the breathing animation will be expressed in a calm state.\nThe higher the value, the higher the amplitude of the animation.\nA value of 0 turns off the breathing animation when the character has full stamina.

Determines how pronounced the breathing animation will be when the stamina is low.\nThe higher the value, the higher the amplitude of the animation.\nA value of 0 turns off the breathing animation when the character has low stamina.
Move weapon down when looking up
Angle to trigger looking up animation
This option determines how high up you need to raise your head for the weapon model to start moving down.\nThe higher the value, the higher you need to look up to start the animation.
Detectors move with weapon when leaning

Because some weapons have a pump action animation during firing (for example, some shotguns or sniper rifles). Firing such weapons while crawling may look incorrect. 
There are several options to solve this problem: 
- all weapons can fire while crawling.
- only certain pump-action shotguns and sniper rifles can't fire while crawling. 
- all weapons can't fire when the character is crawling.
